alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 03 at 1:39PM EDT until April 03 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT/115 PM CDT/ FOR JACKSON...GADSDEN...DECATUR...GRADY AND SEMINOLE COUNTIES... At 139 PM EDT/1239 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of West Bainbridge to 6 miles southwest of Bainbridge to 11 miles northwest of Chattahoochee, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Bainbridge, Donalsonville, Quincy, Havana, Cairo, Marianna, Whigham, Greensboro, West Bainbridge, Chattahoochee, Malone, Sneads, Gretna, Grand Ridge, Greenwood, Attapulgus, Iron City, Climax, Campbellton and Brinson. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT/400 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
